snippet: Six years ago, a McKinsey & Company report said hedge funds “were viewed as high risk.” Now, the report found, investors would rather avoid being hit by a market downturn.
abstract: Six years ago, a McKinsey & Company report said hedge funds “were viewed as high risk.” Now, the report found, investors would rather avoid being hit by a market downturn.

headline.main: Once Flashy, Hedge Funds Now Seen as Staid but Consistent
